passage_text: Mammals are not the only wildlife found in Greece though, there is also an abundance of reptiles and amphibians. Fire salamanders, Wall geckos, and the Turkish Gecko are some of the lizard-like animal life.

Rodents in Greece. Information about the animals living in Greece is brought to you by List of countries of the world , your first stop in discovering all countries and animals of the world. The animals displayed on this page are grouped in their scientific order.

Greece. Greece is home to several mammals found nowhere else including the Cretan Spiny Mouse (flickr), the Cretan Shrew (flickr), and an endemic subspecies: the Cretan Wild Goat or Kri-kri (Wikipedia).

Animals in Greece. Greece has 13,678 km of coastline, between 1200 and 6000 islands, and is eighty percent covered is either hills or mountains. As you might expect, this diverse geography is home to quite an assortment of animal life.

Wild animals indigenous to Greece include boar, bear, wild cat, brown squirrel, jackal, fox, deer, and wolf. A rare white goat is found in Crete. There are 358 species of birds in Greece, two-thirds of them migratory.

Strays and other animals in Greece face increased human cruelty due to the country's ongoing economical crisis and the lack of education and love for animals. Establish immediately stricter legislative framework to prevent more deaths of innocent animals.
